website_summaries.verdict: One of the best budget climbing ropes for longer life and durability after repeated use.
pros: Rope outer skin features greater abrasion resistance than other options
Reduces risk of major major tears and cuts that may weaken structural integrity
cons: The rope is heavier than other options
Prone to fraying if not cared for

customer_reviews.title: Great rope for making smaller safety lines
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rope to craft safety ropes for installing and climbing into treestands for hunting. So far, I have only crafted one lineman rope with it and some attachment points for my treestand life Line, but I found the rope to be easy to work with, and it easily held my weight while installing tree steps and a stand.
customer_reviews.author: Ervin

customer_reviews.title: Great Prusik Core Rope
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this rope for the express purpose of making Prusik Cores. I've made two so far with eye to eye splices on each end. I destroyed the first two as I was learning. Definitely don't catch any inner cord fibers or it's toast. I can't speak knowledgeable about the rope's construction other than I read up on it and the 8 strand double braided polyester is a solid rope for what I need it to do. For what rope costs this is a good deal. I appreciate that it arrived on schedule and it was exactly what they advertised it was. Yes, I'd buy it again. Oh! I tried my Prusik cords and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: 2Old2Worry

customer_reviews.title: It's a beauty.
customer_reviews.text: Orange is my favourite colour, so I am always happy to pull out this cordelette when it's needed. It obviously doesn't stay vibrant with the dirt and dust out on the crags, but it still gets the job done! It's stiff but still easy to tie and untie, even after a day's use. I am very happy with this purchase and would buy again if the occasion arose.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T.

customer_reviews.title: Just what the job needed
customer_reviews.text: As a solar contractor. I use block and tackles to move heavy panels and tanks in to place for hot water systems. These are high quality and stout. It made moving a 300 lbs tank into place very manageable (along with other blocks). I am very pleased with the convenience and performance of the equipment.
customer_reviews.author: A. Burr

customer_reviews.title: GM Climbing 5/16in Accessory 19kN Double Braid Cord Rope
customer_reviews.text: GM Climbing 5/16in Accessory 19kN Double Braid Cord Rope is quality made, lightweight, and affordable. I'll be using this rope for something other than climbing, and I expect it will more than meet my demands for use in Search & Rescue and hunting.
customer_reviews.author: TeeDubyaDee

customer_reviews.title: Just the Right Length for Anchor Building
customer_reviews.text: This accessory cord is perfect for setting up anchors at the top of a climb. The 20ft length is plenty enough to create a long sling around boulders or used to extend an anchor when bolts are far from a ledge to avoid abrasion on your climbing rope. It is also just the right length to create a quad anchor. The rope is supple enough to make knot tying easy, and knots aren't hard to untie after being weighted.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great rope for all climbing or safety needs. Will likely buy another set.
customer_reviews.author: taylor

customer_reviews.title: I used it to make a hoist for a Jeep Wrangler "LIFTED" custom hard top (Heavier than stock due to dual moon roofs and slant back) this works great and the length was just right for my application
customer_reviews.text: Very strong rope, although designed for climbing, I used it to make a hoist for a Jeep Wrangler "LIFTED" custom hard top (Heavier than stock due to dual moon roofs and slant back) this works great and the length was just right for my application.
customer_reviews.author: TXdrawl

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my lone wolf sticks, replacing the original buckles and straps. Lightweight and strong. Would of been 5 stars but only two colors to choose from at the time for this cut length and size.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory cord
customer_reviews.text: Great accessory cord. Works great for my prusiks on my 1/2" climbing rope and my 5/8" lanyard. Grips well, hold knots well, does everything that i bought it for
customer_reviews.author: ThisGuy

customer_reviews.title: Good hitch cord for 1/2" tree climbing rope.
customer_reviews.text: Good prusik cord, locks quickly, unlocks effortlessly, doesn't get dragged into pulley with 1/2" static tree climbing rope. Ties easily.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Magnum Plumber

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I got the 50ft length it's just what I wanted. I made 2 20ft cordellets and 2 5ft Prusik loops out of it. The rope feels great and I definitely like the bright color to keep this easily visually separate from my climbing rope.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Good rope for climbing stick rope modification!
customer_reviews.text: Used this climbing rope to make modification for my muddy climbing sticks for hunting from strap to rope system. They worked great!
customer_reviews.author: jd06

customer_reviews.title: Good feel to the rope
customer_reviews.text: Good feel to the rope. Easy to tie figure eights to hook only and half hitches. Only downside is it seems a to get dirty and frey easily. But overall worth the money .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good brand
customer_reviews.text: Nice reliable cord. GM has become my go to brand for cord and slings. They make really nice equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Strong Rope
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a Yurtz circle with 35 people pulling on it at once. So maybe 6000lbs supported by a square knot.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Mozdrzech

customer_reviews.title: Nice rope
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff for making prusiks or whatever else you want made out of accessory cordage. Good hand, ties nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and as described but...
customer_reviews.text: Great tough climbing rope but a bit bigger than I wanted for Prussik loops. It works but would look for 6-7mm for 1/2” main line.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Polley

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Great for learning knots not enough for 2 Swiss seatss
customer_reviews.author: Dominik

customer_reviews.title: Trustworthy
customer_reviews.text: I put my life in his fibers and I am still here and typing.
customer_reviews.author: Lachezar

customer_reviews.title: Good rope
customer_reviews.text: I like the feel of the rope. Put it in a search and rescue surviver kit I was building.
customer_reviews.author: Firewater

customer_reviews.title: Great for leash!
customer_reviews.text: Love this rope! Perfect for taking my pup to the park and letting him run loose while still keeping him close!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa roberts

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use for canyon cordelettes and for additional pull cord in canyons and it is working out nicely!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super strong
customer_reviews.text: I used them as a prusik for a back up when I rappel. Works great! Really strong rope and it held my weight. The black and blue color is so sick. Only thing is that the shipping took about month! 👎🏽 I know shipping to Hawaii might take awhile, but not a month!
customer_reviews.author: Dre

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain
customer_reviews.text: Great rope for the price. I bought 2 of these for my wtshtf gear. I bought these to be used for Swiss seats. I keep a small amount of climbing/ repelling gear just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Sgt Slapshot

customer_reviews.title: Quality rope
customer_reviews.text: Great rope. Strong but manageable. Flexible enough to tie complex knots but still soft to the touch.
customer_reviews.author: RCS1611

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what it needed!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a 'rope mod' on my climbing sticks and it works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Seaner

customer_reviews.title: Ordering easy, arrived quick
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this yet. Ordering easy, arrived quick, good product. No issues. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory cord
customer_reviews.text: Good cord for tying prussiks or for tying cordelettes for anchor building. It's easy to handle, looks good and ties well.
customer_reviews.author: Thor Twentyy

customer_reviews.title: Good knotability and provides sufficient friction for use as prusik ...
customer_reviews.text: Good knotability and provides sufficient friction for use as prusik cord. I suggest soaking it before first use to remove some of the lubricant that all new rope contains.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Prusik knots.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent service! Just what I need ror Prusik knots on my treestands fall arrest ropes. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: LARRY

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the money
customer_reviews.text: Used this rope for tying pruisiks . It's a good value for the money
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit smaller than I’d expected, but I’m not disappointed! Really great length, sturdiness, security, and color!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Firoved

customer_reviews.title: Seems like solid rope for sure.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to try it yet but it looks like some serious rope for sure. I will update review after I have used it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. . . Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Using this for a dog leash. It's exactly what I needed, and exactly as described. No issues at all, and I'll definitely buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Typical GM Quality
customer_reviews.text: It's just a great item to keep on my harness for tall canopy climbing. It's come in handy on more than a few occasions. I've always had a high level of confidence in GM products.
customer_reviews.author: Auger

customer_reviews.title: Climbing Stick Modification
customer_reviews.text: Got this to do a rope mod on my lone wolf climbing sticks and it works great! Solid stuff, cuts clean, ties neat. Not a ton of stretch. Really happy so far!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Accessory Cordage
customer_reviews.text: Great accessory cordage. I have tied prussiks with it and tethers with it. It has worked for my applications.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Gust

customer_reviews.title: A little stiff but hold knots well
customer_reviews.text: I finally got a chance to try out my accessory cord, worked great, held good knots and untied easy.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth winkles

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Great pliability with a sharp look. Higher strength rating than other ropes at a cheaper price. Nicely packaged
customer_reviews.author: Us4Warners

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was a pretty orange but it's more like hunting orange.
customer_reviews.author: J. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Great prusik rope
customer_reviews.text: Works great for making prusik knots for lifelines going to treestand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality rope. I'm not a professional climber but very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Weber

customer_reviews.title: Great company.
customer_reviews.text: Got my rope quickly and was able to use them for my Search and Rescue class. No problems with the ropes and exactly what was pictured. Great company.
customer_reviews.author: timothy glenn davis

customer_reviews.title: Good rope for firefighting school
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for firefighting school. Mostly to practice knots, but some length of this will end up in my pocket for carry assists and potential escape rope. Good quality and easy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Kratz

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping. Product as expected
customer_reviews.text: Product was as expected. Appears to be well made and strong.
customer_reviews.author: jerry sikes

customer_reviews.title: Solid rope. Very durable; however, very Heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid rope. Very durable; however, very Heavy for a walk-in camping trip or bugout bag.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Langendorf

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good stuff. it has held together for a long time. i loved it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent rope for the cost
customer_reviews.text: excellent rope for the cost. Friction heat resistance is very noticeable with fast rope descent. Ties great, holds strong
customer_reviews.author: E Francke

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very well made and was exactly what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: Miltmonsta

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived when expected and appears to be as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: DIAL/SELF

customer_reviews.title: Great rope! Our 8 year old recently started climbing ...
customer_reviews.text: Great rope! Our 8 year old recently started climbing and this has been very usueful for her to practice on at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality & prompt delivery. Should serve my purpose well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good to have around.
customer_reviews.text: First rope I ever bought for emergencies but it looks good. I don't know much about ropes but I'll use it!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Use at your own risk.
customer_reviews.text: 0 stars if that's an option. THIS IS NOT BACKED BY UIAA. This is made in China by a generic manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Well made rope
customer_reviews.text: Used this to make a few Prussik loops. Well made rope.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked beautifully and did exactly what it was supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F Jacobs

product_meta.title: GM CLIMBING 8mm (5/16in) Accessory Cord Rope 19kN Double Braid Pre Cut CE/UIAA
feature_bullets: GM CLIMBING Double Braid Accessory Cord is in particular designated for outdoor recreation activities, like making prusik loop, lanyard, ice threads for climbing, arborist, mountaineering, caving, and etc.
Supple in handling, flexible and easy to tie knots.

High Abrasion Resistance! Double braid, braided core with braided cover, well elaborated rope construction to make the cord super firm, and this "sturdy sheath" gives it great abrasion resistance which guarantees long-life utilization.
High resistance to moisture, low stretch and high strength! All is due to its all high tenacity polyester material. One more advantage adds to its excellent outdoor environment adaption.

Light weight and compact, takes almost no space in your backpack and easy to carry on. Acts as a great helper for you in outdoor environment. You can find so many creative applications out of this versatile cord.
